name: Country Inn & Suites New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not your typical chain hotel. The front desk lady said it has been renovated from a few warehouses put together. And very perfect for staying to check out the French Quarter, it's all walking distance. And you KNOW after a few of those hurrianes you shouldn't be driving anywhere anyway! This hotel is in a high traffic area so you feel safe walking places because there are people and cars all over.
reviews.title: Awesome location!

likes.liked: — It is so close to the French Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean (but pretty small), the staff is helpful, free internet, and there is a continental breakfast in the am and happy hour drink specials in the pm if you are going the super-budget route. The only downside I found was that you can hear everything that goes on in the halls outside your room, kids running & screaming etc. But well worth staying in, perfect for a weekend getaway! BONUS: our room had a 2007 Zagat Guide for us to read to further research all the yummy places to go eat!
reviews.title: Huge king suit

reviews.text: Great place to stay. huge king suits, and very clean. Within walking distance of the french quarter.
reviews.title: Impressively charming and classy

likes.liked: — The staff their service, spacious suites, CHARMING!
likes.disliked: — That people consider this a low/economy class hotel when it is not!

reviews.text: Made month-long reservations for a business trip and had no idea how great my stay would be. I actually had a chance to move to the Hilton after 2 weeks but decided to stay at CI&S. This is the BEST hotel when looking for elegance, comfort and affordability. EXTERIOR: Designed to blend with historic surroundings of old warehouse style neighborhood - TOTALLY adds to the charm. ATRIUM: Amazing 5 story area of brick and exposed beams. STAFF: Helpful and courteous, from front desk personnel to the maintenance guys. VALETS: Friendly, fun, and professional even during crunch time a.k.a. check out. LOBBY: Offers free internet/printing, and small but respectful library of reading material. SITTING/LOUNGE AREAS: Plentiful and cozy. COURTYARD: CHARMING! Allows hotel to claim New Orleans roots without screaming “recently renovated”. POOL: Small – more like a large spa sans the jets. 4ft depth may be found boring for swimmers but great for a refreshing dip or evening hang out. POOLSIDE BATHROOM/CHANGING ROOM: Nice, roomy and private. WORKOUT ROOM: Good variety of machines with fresh towels available in both pool and workout areas. DÉCOR: Elegant mix of traditional, classic and serene throughout hotel and guest rooms. Be sure to grab a home baked cookie at the front desk on your way to the lobby bar and have a drink and a chat with John the bartender.
reviews.title: Just Gorgeous

likes.disliked: — nothing (maybe get real crockery and cutlery)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found all the room amenities listed on the website accurate. 2 room suites along Natchez (bedroom and living room) seemed more like a small apartment than hotel room. The King beds are high, soft and sleep inducing. Housekeeping was GREAT, consistent, thorough, patient and friendly. The dining room was always clean and neat. Breakfast offers an incredible variety, even for continental. If you walk away hungry then its your fault.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.liked: — The lobby and the rooms (great appeal)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there for 2 nights, had to switch rooms because they booked the suite we were in for someone else on the 2nd night and got transferred to a regular room. That was kind of annoying but we dealt with it. Rooms were clean and nice, the beds were comfortable, the rooms are nice though there's no "good views" really. Valet parking is worth paying for, they were very nice and even ran to get items for us that we forgot in the car(the hotel parking deck is 2 blocks away). The breakfast is basic but good, good for grabbing a small bite to eat before going out. The pool is outdoors and tiny, was not impressed with that in the slightest. For the money and being so close to the French Quarter it's worth it.
reviews.title: A good place to stay.

likes.disliked: — Having to change rooms, tiny out door pool.

reviews.text: Especially nice features:
reviews.title: Yes, this is the place you should stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Location near, but not in, the French Quarter
reviews.title: Great Time

likes.disliked: — The pool size and area (no lounge chairs)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Adaptation of interesting old architecture to new purposes
reviews.title: Great For The Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Helpful, friendly staff
reviews.title: Location, Facility, Staff: WONDERFUL!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in Mid November. Hotel pluses: value is great, free cookies, free decent breakfast, quiet rooms and great location close to the French Quarter etc. No real negatives other than maybe they could have more of a bar instead of 3 stools at a counter but I quibble. I would try to get a room not on the street as we switched rooms after one night.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Money

reviews.text: Country Inn and Suites was in a great location, and staff (esp. at breakfast) was excellent. Had a two room suite, living area a bit small and small window in bedroom but very clean and comfy beds. Used laptops both wired and wireless with no problems. Guy in next room came in at 4am and turned tv on LOUD, waking us up. I called front desk and they called him immediately and he turned down the volume. Tiny complaint was that brochure for hotel says they have sausage at complimentary breakfast, but they did not. I didn't care but I had told men in the family that hotel had meat at breakfast and they were a little annoyed at its absence. Would definitely stay at this location again.
reviews.title: Very pleased with Country Inn and Suites!

reviews.text: The Country Inn & Suits Hotel in New Orleans was excellent for the low price that I paid. First of all, the hotel facilities and the actual hotel room itself were both immaculately clean, which is always a plus in my book. The rooms are not huge, but spacious enough for a comfortable stay. The bed was also super comfortable, which helps after a long night of partying on Bourbon Street. On top of the general aesthetic and comfort of the hotel, the staff is both friendly and helpful. I checked-in and out of the hotel with ease and received prompt service when I had any questions or requests.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel & Convenient Location

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is quite ideal as well since it is right in the central business district and just a stones throw (i.e. 5 - 10 minute walk) from the French Quarter and excitement of Bourbon Street. You are close enough to experience the party and easily walk home, but far enough away where you get some peace, quiet and relaxation. I also found that the hotel was located a convenient distance from most other attractions and only a few blocks away from the St. Charles Street car.
reviews.title: Excellent choice -excellent value- good location!!

reviews.text: My family (my husband, two teenagers, and I) stayed here for four nights in July. The hotel lobby was lovely and our room was large. I would highly recommend NOT getting a room on the street level. We checked in early and they asked if we would mind, and we said okay, but it was a mistake. Very early in the morning (around 6 a.m.), every morning, we heard some sort of truck outside. Not sure if it was trash pick-up or some sort of construction, but it was impossible to sleep through. Also, you must keep your curtains closed because people on the street tend to look right in.
reviews.title: Pretty Good...

reviews.text: The hotel location was okay. We didn't want to be on Bourbon St. because of noise, but it was a bit farther than I thought it would be from the Market and the heart of the French Quarter. However, it is close to the Aquarium and Harrah's if you're planning to go to either of those places.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The hotel concierge was nice and helpful, and the front desk staff was okay, depending on the day. The Cuban restaurant next door is excellent, but there are no other places to eat very close by that we could find. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was quite good, considering that it was free.
reviews.title: Great stay!!

reviews.text: Parking was $25 a day, but that's standard for NOLA. The pool was TINY--really not a pool at all. Since there was a family and their child there everyday when we visited, we couldn't get in, but that wasn't their fault. They were hot just like we were. If you're not a smoker, you might want to stay away from the pool area anyway, since that is a smoking area and the smell was horrible and we couldn't stay out there because it is very small and people were smoking.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

reviews.text: Overall it was just okay. The room was clean, the housekeeping staff was nice and accomodating, and the bartender is very cool. I don't think I'd go back mostly because of the location, but it was a good deal for the price.
reviews.title: Great for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives (sorry!): Room air conditioning units work almost too good, noisy garbage trucks collects between 3-5am - request an inside room if this will affect your stay, though there are plenty of sitting areas, the hotel isn’t huge and when large groups stay it seems like they are “taking over” the entire hotel.
reviews.title: country inn N.O

likes.liked: — clean room, building looks fresh and newly converted

reviews.text: Breakfast inc- basic but good- have a shot of the waffle machine.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for a city trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is a converted warehouse, looks good in the hallway where you can see the original exposed beams.
reviews.title: Great Rate...Great Bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a free access PC and Printer in the Lobby
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Bargain!

likes.liked: — Lobby has unique architecture, a fine example of a new direction for the neighborhood
likes.disliked: — Magazine Street not in the best condition - reminders of Katrina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Magazine st, is just off the French Q, worth staying as its abit less noisy, if heading for Bourbon st , recommend going along one the streets parrallel with it and up onto the st instead of gonig up Canal st, its quite edgy at night.
reviews.title: Great for the price!

reviews.text: I have stayed in hotels in Metairie, Kenner, the French Quarter, the Warehouse District, the Garden District, on Canal and on Bourbon Street and even in LaPlace one year when I waited too long to make reservations--you name it. Country Inn is a safe place for a single female traveler that doesn't cost $400 a night during Jazz Fest. New Orleans is not a safe place for a single female walking alone, and this hotel is near enough Canal Street that even at night and with the other tourists coming and going to the hotels in the area of this one, a single female is safe going out to dinner after dark. There has been many a night when I got a bargain room in NO but was terrified to leave it alone after dark--ordered pizza in. The hotel is new--none of the mold/mildew problems you see in some of the older, more expensive hotels. The breakfast is ok with me. They have fresh fruit, bagels, and coffee, along with the waffles, so I was happy. The staff is friendly. The bartender was a great guy. I never one time felt afraid, and I have seen people mugged right in front of me when exiting other hotels in NO, so I know of what I speak. The Jazz Festival is absolutely addictive--every year of the 15 I have gone I have never once been disappointed. This is a great city with great food and great people--just pay attention and stay safe.
reviews.title: Best Over All Hotel in 15 Years of Attending Jazz Fest

reviews.text: Warnings?? What warnings?!? My friends and I decided we'd beat the odds this year and enjoy Southern Decadence in New Orleans for our first time in four years (the year before Katrina). Our plane landed and we grabbed the first available cab. As it arrived at the front of the hotel, I immediately was pleased with the location....not exactly in the middle of the French Qtr but definitely within walking distance (5 blocks tops). The front desk staff was sufficiently helpful (nothing special but why would they be - a hurricane's coming) and the room was just right. Many have complained about the pool and it is kinda small but I thought it fit the hotel perfectly. However, if you are looking for a pool to make your trip, this one is not it. We were soon out of the hotel and made our way next door to Hurrahs Casino and from there to Bourbon. Our trip, as you may know, was cut short as the city was evacuated 24 hours after we arrived. The hotel staff was very instrumental in getting us on the first cab to the airport where we scored standby tickets on the first plane home. So, was having to leave the Big Easy a little early a bummer? Sure. But we now have our own Amazing Race story to tell and the hotel compliments its nicely.
reviews.title: On The Run from Gustav

reviews.text: After looking at reviews for hotels in New Orleans on TripAdvisor, my friends and I were very excited to be staying at the Country Inn and Suites. It was one of the highest ranking hotels, in a great location, and affordable! Plus, people raved about the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel, but definitely not the best New Orleans has to offer...

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong; this hotel is decent. But that's about all it is. With all the cute hotels with lots of character and/or the fancy hotels with gorgeous chandeliers or modern design, when we walked into the Country Inn and Suites, we were unimpressed. I like exposed wood beams, but the hotel just doesn't have a lot of character.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Our hotel room had two queen beds, and the size was decent. The beds were averagely comfortable, though one of my pillows was synthetic and the other one seemed to be down-like. Neither was terribly comfortable. The bathroom was clean but not immaculate. And the water in the shower had two option: scalding hot or lukewarm.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

aka: Country Inn & Suites New Orleans Hotel New Orleans
